plot: In 16th-century Prague, a rabbi creates a giant creature from clay, called the Golem, and using sorcery, brings the creature to life in order to protect the Jews of Prague from persecution.

m.role: Dumb Muscle: The Golem. Demonstrated nicely when the Golem breaks the massive bar of the Ghetto gate to burst it open — instead of just lifting it by the appropriate handle.
The Dandy: The foppish Knight Florian.
The silent movie classic The Golem has Knight Florian, an effeminate fop that wears a ridiculous hat and is constantly twirling a rose.
Wizard Beard: The Rabbi again. Also, his hair would pass as Einstein Hair, had the trope existed at the time.

f.role: Mad Scientist's Beautiful Daughter: Played with. The learned Rabbi's only child, beautiful Miriam, falls promptly in a forbidden love with the Christian knight Florian. However, Florian is not exactly a hero, and the romance is cut short by Florian's death. Also, the Rabbi is neither mad nor evil, even though his creation runs out of control.

The learned Rabbi of the silent movie The Golem has his beautiful daughter Miriam, who promptly falls in a forbidden love with the christian Knight Florian. Their romance turns out to be a Red Herring Twist, though.

name: The Golem
